alert.note: Alert for Graham (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 07 at 5:38PM MST until August 07 at 7:30PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL GRAHAM COUNTY... At 538 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen east of Highway 191 in the Swift Trail Junction area. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Safford, Solomon, Roper Lake State Park and Swift Trail Junction. This includes the following highways... Route 191 between mile markers 99 and 118...and near mile marker 131. Route 70 between mile markers 345 and 353. Route 266 between mile markers 105 and 119. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
